intro: Ruellia blanchetiana, commonly known as the Mexican bluebell, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or short-lived perennial, often reaching heights of up to 60 cm. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its stems are hairy and branching. Ruellia blanchetiana is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
